org.epochx.ref
Class ListenerList<T extends Listener>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<T>
          org.epochx.ref.ListenerList<T>
Type Parameters:
T -
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.List<T>
public class ListenerList<T extends Listener>
extends java.util.AbstractList<T>

A List specifically for managing listeners. Each listener element is wrapped in a MixedReference instance which optionally allows each individual listener to be referenced either strongly or weakly - thus allowing the listener to be cleared by the garbage collected when it is no longer needed. By default strong references are used and in such a case the list behaves exactly like a normal list of listeners. Part of the process of adding a new listener to the list is checking for dead entries and removing them. The process of removing weakly referenced listeners is at the mercy of the garbage collector and so there is no guarentee that listeners will be removed promptly when only weak references remain. In some applications it might be appropriate to make a call to System.gc() to encourage the garbage collector to release these references.

add

public void add(int index,
                T element)

Specified by:

add

public void add(int index,
                T element,
                boolean strong)
Adds a new listener to the list at the given index using either a strong or a weak reference. After adding the new listener, the list will be expunged of any null references and so on return from this method the listener being set may no longer be at the given index.

Parameters:
index - the index that the given element should be set at.
element - the listener instance to be inserted into the list.
strong - true if a strong reference should be maintained to the listener instance, and false if only a weak reference should be used.

add

public boolean add(T element,
                   boolean strong)
Adds a new listener to the end of the list using either a strong or a weak reference. The list will also be expunged of any null references and so on return from this method the size of the list may have reduced.

Parameters:
element - the listener instance to be appended to the list.
strong - true if a strong reference should be maintained to the listener instance, and false if only a weak reference should be used.
Returns:
true if the given element was successfully added to the list, false otherwise.

set

public T set(int index,
             T element,
             boolean strong)
Puts the given listener into this list at the specified index, replacing the current listener at that index. Either a strong or a weak reference is maintained to the listener depending upon the strong parameter.

Parameters:
index - the index that the given element should be set at.
element - the listener instance to be inserted into the list.
strong - true if a strong reference should be maintained to the listener instance, and false if only a weak reference should be used.
